page.title: 12Home Life In South Kyme-1
page.content: South Kyme still sticks to its' rural roots. Not all inhabitants are involved directly with agriculture, as was once the case. A Lot of people from other areas have moved here and this has changed the fabric of the village. Many residents grow their own vegetables, and the traditional meat and two veg. is the normal everyday fare, though more adventurous food, and also convenience foods have put in an appearance. Breakfast is mainly cereals and toast, rather than the traditional bacon and eggs. Potatoes form an important part of the diet. Freezers are popular and a lot of home grown fruit and veg. is frozen. In the shooting season game is eaten or frozen. Mealtimes are usually early, with lunch at 11am. for the workers. There is much more awareness of wholefoods and avoiding additives.
